TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IWithKeyVault

Docs.summary: An app service certificate order definition allowing more domain verification methods to be set.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Azure.Management.AppService.Fluent.AppServiceCertificateOrder.Definition.IWithCreate WithExistingKeyVault(class Microsoft.Azure.Management.KeyVault.Fluent.IVault vault) cil managed

Docs.param: The vault to store the private key.
Docs.summary: Specifies an existing key vault to store the certificate private key. The vault MUST allow 2 service principals to read/write secrets: f3c21649-0979-4721-ac85-b0216b2cf413 and abfa0a7c-a6b6-4736-8310-5855508787cd. If they don't have access, an attempt will be made to grant access. If you are logged in from an identity without access to the Active Directory Graph, this attempt will fail.
Docs.return: The next stage of the app service certificate definition.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Azure.Management.AppService.Fluent.AppServiceCertificateOrder.Definition.IWithCreate WithNewKeyVault(string vaultName, class Microsoft.Azure.Management.ResourceManager.Fluent.Core.Region region) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the new key vault.
The region to create the vault.
Docs.summary: Creates a new key vault to store the certificate private key. DO NOT use this method if you are logged in from an identity without access to the Active Directory Graph.
Docs.return: The next stage of the app service certificate definition.
